questions.question: Mormons moved from New York to the West in the Early 1830s in order to

choices.answer: seek out religious freedom
start a new religion
Because the weather was better
to take advantage of cheap land prices

questions.question: Brigham Young became the leader of the Mormon Church immediately following the death of

choices.answer: Joseph Brown
John C. Calhoun
Sequoya
Joseph Smith

questions.question: How many of the Alamo's defenders were killed at the battle?

choices.answer: None were killed
All of them were killed
Nearly two/thirds were killed

questions.question: How did the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo, signed in 1848, affect the United States?

choices.answer: It drew the final border between Mexico and the US
It increased the US by almost 25%
It enabled the US to collect millions in taxes from Mexico
It forced the US to give up vast territories in the west.

questions.question: Which of the following statements was true of the Oregon Trail?

choices.answer: It ran through the Sierra Nevada
It required protect by US troops
It was a popular route for merchants
It took six months to travel

questions.question: How did the Cherokee people first try to resist removal to Indian territory?

choices.answer: The adopted the contemporary, white culture of Americans
They traded tribal goods for knives, guns, and other weapons
They brought a case against the state to a federal court
They published a newspaper directed at federal officials

questions.question: What were John C. Calhoun's views on the Tariff of Abominations?

choices.answer: He supported the Tariff as a Southerner
He resigned the Vice Presidency over the issue of tariffs
The Tariff was not well named
The Tariff only protected Southerners

questions.question: What was mostly responsible for making emancipation almost impossible in the South in the 1820s

choices.answer: Sectionalism linked to the division between North and South
The South's economic dependence on slavery
slaveholders' political influence in the nation's capital
promotion by northern Christians justifying slavery

questions.question: How did the Gadsden Purchase benefit the United States?

choices.answer: It safeguarded the property of long time US residents
It gave the US hunting rights north of the Rio Grande
It allowed the US to purchase the northern part of Illinois
It secured a southern route for a transcontinental railroad

questions.question: Which of the following factors helped Texans gain victory in the Battle of San Jacinto?

choices.answer: Frontiersmen Davy Crockett joined the Texas defenses.
General Santa Anna had been imprisoned at the Alamo
Sam Houston's men took the Mexican Army by surprise
Prisoners at Goliad were released, adding to Texas defenses

questions.question: Which of the following was a consequence of Worcester v. Georgia?

choices.answer: Georgia ignored it; Jackson would not enforce it.
Georgia allowed the Cherokee to establish their own govt
Jackson allowed the Cherokee to stay in Georgia
Jackson ordered all troops to keep out of Indian lands

questions.question: Father Hidalgo y Costilla's rebellion in 1810

choices.answer: started the Mexican antislavery movement
inspired the Mexican independence movement
promoted nonviolent revolution
overthrew the Spanish monarchy

questions.question: What was Andrew Jackson's view on the Second Bank of the United States?

choices.answer: It should have the power to act exclusively for the nation
It should be privately owned, by supervised by Congress
It was unconstitutional extension of Congress
It was a welfare agency for wealthy politicians

questions.question: How did Brigham Young's influence resolve the western dispute over water rights?

choices.answer: He supported the eastern tradition of equal access to water
He was strict, favoring community interests over individuals
He established private canals and waterways
He set a tax on the public use of water and river navigation

questions.question: What aspect of Native American History became known as the "Trail of Tears?"

choices.answer: The blood that flowed from Sauk Indians in  Black Hawk War
The forced 800 mile march Cherokee made from Georgia
The line of settlement connecting Seminole and Florida
The unpublished works of the Cherokee written by Sequoya

questions.question: Which of the following was a consequence of the Missouri Compromise?

choices.answer: Missouri entered the Union as independent territory
Slavery was pronounced unconstitutional
Free states won a majority in the House of Representatives
A equal balance between free and slave states was maintained

questions.question: Why did both British Canada and the US want control over the Oregon Country?

choices.answer: They wanted to gain access to the Pacific
They were interested in the region's valuable fur trade
They were interested in fertile land and good climate
They wanted to patrol Canada's border

questions.question: Who benefited most from Andrew Jackson's plan to remove American Indians to the West?

choices.answer: American Indians, who gained protection by the US government
Andrew Jackson, who gained public approval with his policy
American farmers, who gained millions of acres of farmland
Cherokee Indians, who gained a new model of government

questions.question: What was Sequoya's role in Native American history?

choices.answer: He led a Cherokee attack on Georgia troops
He created a writing system for the Cherokee language
He sued the state of Georgia for illegal occupation of land
He modeled the first Cherokee government after the US govt

questions.question: Why did some politicians support Polk's interest in annexing Oregon?

choices.answer: Disputes over the US border with Canada would end
Merchants would benefit from a Pacific port for trade
Free and slave states were out of balance
Explorers reported spotting gold dust along the Colorado Rvr
